sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: The &app; application enables you to play audio Compact Discs (CDs) on your computer. You can use CD Player to perform the following tasks with audio CDs:

listitem.para: Play, pause, stop, or eject a CD.
Move through the tracks on the CD.
Adjust the output volume from the CD Player.
Edit the track information.

sect2.title: To Start CD Player
sect2.para: You can start &app; in the following ways:

listitem.para:
Choose
Sound & Video &app; .
Type gnome-cd, then press Return.

sect2.title: When You Start CD Player
sect2.para: When you start &app;, the following window is displayed.
The &app; window contains the following elements:

listitem.para:
A
Shows Open track editor button. button that enables you to open the Track Editor dialog.

A
Shows Preferences button. button that enables you to open the Preferences dialog.
A display area that displays details about the CD that you are playing.
A slider control that enables you to control the output volume.
A drop-down list that enables you to view the names of the tracks on the CD and move to a track.
A button area that enables you to play the tracks on the CD.

sect2.title: To Play a CD
sect2.para:
To play a CD, insert the CD in the CD drive of your computer, then press the
Shows Play button. button.
The application displays the following information in the display area:

listitem.para: The time elapsed on the current track.
The name of the artist.
The title of the CD.

sect2.title: To Pause a CD
sect2.para:
To pause a CD that is playing, click on the
Shows Pause button. button. To resume playing the CD, click on the
Shows Play button. button again.

sect2.title: To Move Through Tracks
sect2.para: To play different tracks on the CD, perform the following actions:

listitem.para:
To move to the next track on the CD, click on the
Shows Next track button. button.

To move to the previous track on the CD, click twice on the
Shows Previous track button. button.
To display a list of the tracks on the CD, click on the drop-down list located below the display area. To move to a track on the list, select a track from the list.

sect2.title: To Fast Forward a Track
sect2.para:
To fast forward a track, click on the
Shows Fast forward button. button.

sect2.title: To Rewind a Track
sect2.para:
To rewind a track, click on the
Shows Rewind button. button.

sect2.title: To Stop a CD
sect2.para:
To stop playing a CD, click on the
Shows Stop button. button.

sect2.title: To Adjust the Volume
sect2.para: To adjust the output volume of the CD Player, move the volume slider to specify the volume level you require. The volume slider is located to the right of the display area in the application window. Move the slider upwards to increase the volume. Move the slider downwards to decrease the volume.

sect2.title: To Edit CD Information
sect2.para: To edit the CD information, perform the following steps:

listitem.para:
To open the Track Editor dialog, click on the
button. The Track Editor dialog is displayed, see .
To edit the name of the artist, edit the contents of the Artist text box.
To edit the title of the CD, edit the contents of the Disc Title text box.
To add comments about the CD, the genre of music, and the year the CD was produced, click on the arrow next to Show advanced disc options.
To edit the title of a track, double-click on the track in the Title column of the track table, then type the new title.
To add additional information about a track, select the track in the track table, then click on the arrow next to Show advanced track options.
Type the additional track information in the Extra track data text box.
To save the changes on your local computer, click Save.

sect2.title: To Eject a CD
sect2.para:
To eject a CD, click on the
Shows Eject CD button. button. This action stops the CD if the CD is still playing, and opens the CD tray.

sect1.title: Preferences
sect1.para:
To configure &app;, click on the
Shows Preferences button. button.

listitem.para: Use this text box to specify the name of the CDROM device. Click Apply change to save a change to this setting.
